title: [BUG] Race condition in create_experiment with PostgresSql Backend

labels.name: area/tracking
labels.description: Tracking service, tracking client APIs, autologging

labels.name: priority/important-longterm
labels.description: Important over the long term, but may not be staffed or may need multiple releases to complete.

body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: We wrapped Scala around the Java Implementation but this is pretty sure not influencing the issue
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Debian 10 
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: pypi
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: mlflow, version 1.1.0
- **Python version**: 3.6.9
- **Exact command to reproduce**: create_experiment(self, name, artifact_location=None):

### Describe the problem
If multiple runs of the same experiment starts simultaneously and execute the create_experiment rest call. Our PostgresSQL throws following error:
ERROR:  duplicate key value violates unique constraint "experiments_name_key"
DETAIL:  Key (name)=(***) already exists.
INSERT INTO experiments (name, artifact_location, lifecycle_stage) VALUES ('***', '', 'active') RETURNING experiments.experiment_id

### expected behavior ###
Multiple create_experiment calls with the same experiment name will return the same unique experiment-id, so parallel/distributed training is easily possible.


### Relatives ###
Here we need a lock and/or create_or_get experiment-id handling:
https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/30a90ec9cbffa5c0d0212368b9f2a7e8c8a3fc81/mlflow/store/sqlalchemy_store.py#L238
